revised_title: A Study of the January 1731 Frost and Its Impact on the Environment
tldr: The author, William Derham, compares the intensity of the frost in January 1731 to previous notable frosts, such as those in 1708 and 1716. He discusses the effects of the frost on the environment, particularly the freezing of the River Thames, and the importance of the duration of the cold weather in causing such extreme congelations.
